00285 #ifdef UNICODE
00286 /*
00287  *      To convert strings to UNICODE. We have a level of indirection so things
00288  *      like T(__FILE__) will expand properly.
00289  */
00290 #define T(x)                            __TXT(x)
00291 #define __TXT(s)                        L ## s
00292 typedef unsigned short          char_t;
00293 typedef unsigned short          uchar_t;
00294 
00295 /*
00296  *      Text size of buffer macro. A buffer bytes will hold (size / char size) 
00297  *      characters. 
00298  */
00299 #define TSZ(x)                          (sizeof(x) / sizeof(char_t))
00300 
00301 /*
00302  *      How many ASCII bytes are required to represent this UNICODE string?
00303  */
00304 #define TASTRL(x)                       ((wcslen(x) + 1) * sizeof(char_t))
00305 
00306 #else
00307 #define T(s)                            s
00308 typedef char                            char_t;
00309 #define TSZ(x)                          (sizeof(x))
00310 #define TASTRL(x)                       (strlen(x) + 1)
00311 #ifdef WIN
00312 typedef unsigned char           uchar_t;
00313 #endif /* WIN */
00314 
00315 #endif /* UNICODE */

00560 /******************************************************************************/
00561 /*
00562  *      These values are not prefixed so as to aid code readability
00563  */
00564 
00565 typedef enum {
00566         undefined       = 0,
00567         byteint         = 1,
00568         shortint        = 2,
00569         integer         = 3,
00570         hex                     = 4,
00571         percent         = 5,
00572         octal           = 6,
00573         big                     = 7,
00574         flag            = 8,
00575         floating        = 9,
00576         string          = 10,
00577         bytes           = 11,
00578         symbol          = 12,
00579         errmsg          = 13
00580 } vtype_t;
00581 
00582 #ifndef __NO_PACK
00583 #pragma pack(2)
00584 #endif /* _NO_PACK */
00585 
00586 typedef struct {
00587 
00588         union {
00589                 char    flag;
00590                 char    byteint;
00591                 short   shortint;
00592                 char    percent;
00593                 long    integer;
00594                 long    hex;
00595                 long    octal;
00596                 long    big[2];
00597 #ifdef FLOATING_POINT_SUPPORT
00598                 double  floating;
00599 #endif /* FLOATING_POINT_SUPPORT */
00600                 char_t  *string;
00601                 char    *bytes;
00602                 char_t  *errmsg;
00603                 void    *symbol;
00604         } value;
00605 
00606         vtype_t                 type;
00607         unsigned int    valid           : 8;
00608         unsigned int    allocated       : 8;            /* String was balloced */
00609 } value_t;
00610 
00611 #ifndef __NO_PACK
00612 #pragma pack()
00613 #endif /* __NO_PACK */

00615 /*
00616  *      Allocation flags 
00617  */
00618 #define VALUE_ALLOCATE          0x1
00619 
00620 #define value_numeric(t)        (t >= byteint && t <= big)
00621 #define value_str(t)            (t >= string && t <= bytes)
00622 #define value_ok(t)             (t > undefined && t <= symbol)
00623 
00624 #define VALUE_VALID                     { {0}, integer, 1 }
00625 #define VALUE_INVALID           { {0}, undefined, 0 }
00626 
00627 /******************************************************************************/
00628 /*
00629  *      A ring queue allows maximum utilization of memory for data storage and is
00630  *      ideal for input/output buffering. This module provides a highly effecient
00631  *      implementation and a vehicle for dynamic strings.
00632  *
00633  *      WARNING:  This is a public implementation and callers have full access to
00634  *      the queue structure and pointers.  Change this module very carefully.
00635  *
00636  *      This module follows the open/close model.
00637  *
00638  *      Operation of a ringq where rq is a pointer to a ringq :
00639  *
00640  *              rq->buflen contains the size of the buffer.
00641  *              rq->buf will point to the start of the buffer.
00642  *              rq->servp will point to the first (un-consumed) data byte.
00643  *              rq->endp will point to the next free location to which new data is added
00644  *              rq->endbuf will point to one past the end of the buffer.
00645  *
00646  *      Eg. If the ringq contains the data "abcdef", it might look like :
00647  *
00648  *      +-------------------------------------------------------------------+
00649  *  |   |   |   |   |   |   |   | a | b | c | d | e | f |   |   |   |   |
00650  *      +-------------------------------------------------------------------+
00651  *    ^                           ^                       ^               ^
00652  *    |                           |                       |               |
00653  *  rq->buf                    rq->servp               rq->endp      rq->enduf
00654  *     
00655  *      The queue is empty when servp == endp.  This means that the queue will hold
00656  *      at most rq->buflen -1 bytes.  It is the fillers responsibility to ensure
00657  *      the ringq is never filled such that servp == endp.
00658  *
00659  *      It is the fillers responsibility to "wrap" the endp back to point to
00660  *      rq->buf when the pointer steps past the end. Correspondingly it is the
00661  *      consumers responsibility to "wrap" the servp when it steps to rq->endbuf.
00662  *      The ringqPutc and ringqGetc routines will do this automatically.
00663  */
00664 
00665 /*
00666  *      Ring queue buffer structure
00667  */
00668 typedef struct {
00669         unsigned char   *buf;                           /* Holding buffer for data */
00670         unsigned char   *servp;                         /* Pointer to start of data */
00671         unsigned char   *endp;                          /* Pointer to end of data */
00672         unsigned char   *endbuf;                        /* Pointer to end of buffer */
00673         int                             buflen;                         /* Length of ring queue */
00674         int                             maxsize;                        /* Maximum size */
00675         int                             increment;                      /* Growth increment */
00676 } ringq_t;
00677 
00678 /*
00679  *      Block allocation (balloc) definitions
00680  */
00681 #ifdef  B_STATS
00682 #ifndef B_L
00683 #define B_L                             T(__FILE__), __LINE__
00684 #define B_ARGS_DEC              char_t *file, int line
00685 #define B_ARGS                  file, line
00686 #endif /* B_L */
00687 #endif /* B_STATS */
00688 
00689 /*
00690  *      Block classes are: 16, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, 
00691  *                                         16384, 32768, 65536 
00692  */
00693 typedef struct {
00694         union {
00695                 void    *next;                                                  /* Pointer to next in q */
00696                 int             size;                                                   /* Actual requested size */
00697         } u;
00698         int                     flags;                                                  /* Per block allocation flags */
00699 } bType;
00700 
00701 #define B_SHIFT                 4                                       /* Convert size to class */
00702 #define B_ROUND                 ((1 << (B_SHIFT)) - 1)
00703 #define B_MAX_CLASS             13                                      /* Maximum class number + 1 */
00704 #define B_MALLOCED              0x80000000                      /* Block was malloced */
00705 #define B_DEFAULT_MEM   (64 * 1024)                     /* Default memory allocation */
00706 #define B_MAX_FILES             (512)                           /* Maximum number of files */
00707 #define B_FILL_CHAR             (0x77)                          /* Fill byte for buffers */
00708 #define B_FILL_WORD             (0x77777777)            /* Fill word for buffers */
00709 #define B_MAX_BLOCKS    (64 * 1024)                     /* Maximum allocated blocks */
00710 
00711 /*
00712  *      Flags. The integrity value is used as an arbitrary value to fill the flags.
00713  */
00714 #define B_INTEGRITY                     0x8124000               /* Integrity value */
00715 #define B_INTEGRITY_MASK        0xFFFF000               /* Integrity mask */
00716 #define B_USE_MALLOC            0x1                             /* Okay to use malloc if required */
00717 #define B_USER_BUF                      0x2                             /* User supplied buffer for mem */
00718 
00719 /*
00720  *      The symbol table record for each symbol entry
00721  */
00722 
00723 typedef struct sym_t {
00724         struct sym_t    *forw;                                  /* Pointer to next hash list */
00725         value_t                 name;                                   /* Name of symbol */
00726         value_t                 content;                                /* Value of symbol */
00727         int                             arg;                                    /* Parameter value */
00728 } sym_t;
00729 
00730 typedef int sym_fd_t;                                           /* Returned by symOpen */
00731

00733  *      Script engines
00734  */
00735 #define EMF_SCRIPT_JSCRIPT                      0               /* javascript */
00736 #define EMF_SCRIPT_TCL                          1               /* tcl */
00737 #define EMF_SCRIPT_EJSCRIPT             2               /* Ejscript */
00738 #define EMF_SCRIPT_MAX                          3
00739 
00740 #define MAXINT          INT_MAX
00741 #define BITSPERBYTE 8
00742 #define BITS(type)      (BITSPERBYTE * (int) sizeof(type))
00743 #define STRSPACE        T("\t \n\r\t")
00744 
00745 #ifndef max
00746 #define max(a,b)  (((a) > (b)) ? (a) : (b))
00747 #endif /* max */
00748 
00749 #ifndef min
00750 #define min(a,b)  (((a) < (b)) ? (a) : (b))
00751 #endif /* min */

00776 #if ((defined (WIN) || defined (CE)) && defined (WEBS))
00777 #define EWOULDBLOCK             WSAEWOULDBLOCK
00778 #define ENETDOWN                WSAENETDOWN
00779 #define ECONNRESET              WSAECONNRESET
00780 #endif /* (WIN || CE) && WEBS) */
00781 
00782 #define SOCKET_EOF                              0x1             /* Seen end of file */
00783 #define SOCKET_CONNECTING               0x2             /* Connect in progress */
00784 #define SOCKET_BROADCAST                0x4             /* Broadcast mode */
00785 #define SOCKET_PENDING                  0x8             /* Message pending on this socket */
00786 #define SOCKET_FLUSHING                 0x10    /* Background flushing */
00787 #define SOCKET_DATAGRAM                 0x20    /* Use datagrams */
00788 #define SOCKET_ASYNC                    0x40    /* Use async connect */
00789 #define SOCKET_BLOCK                    0x80    /* Use blocking I/O */
00790 #define SOCKET_LISTENING                0x100   /* Socket is server listener */
00791 #define SOCKET_CLOSING                  0x200   /* Socket is closing */
00792 #define SOCKET_CONNRESET                0x400   /* Socket connection was reset */
00793 
00794 #define SOCKET_PORT_MAX                 0xffff  /* Max Port size */
00795 
00796 /*
00797  *      Socket error values
00798  */
00799 #define SOCKET_WOULDBLOCK               1               /* Socket would block on I/O */
00800 #define SOCKET_RESET                    2               /* Socket has been reset */
00801 #define SOCKET_NETDOWN                  3               /* Network is down */
00802 #define SOCKET_AGAIN                    4               /* Issue the request again */
00803 #define SOCKET_INTR                             5               /* Call was interrupted */
00804 #define SOCKET_INVAL                    6               /* Invalid */
00805 
00806 /*
00807  *      Handler event masks
00808  */
00809 #define SOCKET_READABLE                 0x2             /* Make socket readable */ 
00810 #define SOCKET_WRITABLE                 0x4             /* Make socket writable */
00811 #define SOCKET_EXCEPTION                0x8             /* Interested in exceptions */
00812 #define EMF_SOCKET_MESSAGE              (WM_USER+13)
00813 
00814 #ifdef LITTLEFOOT
00815 #define SOCKET_BUFSIZ                   510             /* Underlying buffer size */
00816 #else
00817 #define SOCKET_BUFSIZ                   1024    /* Underlying buffer size */
00818 #endif /* LITTLEFOOT */
00819 
00820 typedef void    (*socketHandler_t)(int sid, int mask, int data);
00821 typedef int             (*socketAccept_t)(int sid, char *ipaddr, int port, 
00822                                         int listenSid);
00823 typedef struct {
00824         char                    host[64];                               /* Host name */
00825         ringq_t                 inBuf;                                  /* Input ring queue */
00826         ringq_t                 outBuf;                                 /* Output ring queue */
00827         ringq_t                 lineBuf;                                /* Line ring queue */
00828         socketAccept_t  accept;                                 /* Accept handler */
00829         socketHandler_t handler;                                /* User I/O handler */
00830         int                             handler_data;                   /* User handler data */
00831         int                             handlerMask;                    /* Handler events of interest */
00832         int                             sid;                                    /* Index into socket[] */
00833         int                             port;                                   /* Port to listen on */
00834         int                             flags;                                  /* Current state flags */
00835         int                             sock;                                   /* Actual socket handle */
00836         int                             fileHandle;                             /* ID of the file handler */
00837         int                             interestEvents;                 /* Mask of events to watch for */
00838         int                             currentEvents;                  /* Mask of ready events (FD_xx) */
00839         int                             selectEvents;                   /* Events being selected */
00840         int                             saveMask;                               /* saved Mask for socketFlush */
00841         int                             error;                                  /* Last error */
00842 } socket_t;

00855  *              #define NO_BALLOC 1

00860 #define bfree(B_ARGS, p) free(p)

00862         if (p) { free(p); } else
00863 #define brealloc(B_ARGS, p, num) realloc(p, num)
00864 extern char_t *bstrdupNoBalloc(char_t *s);
00865 extern char *bstrdupANoBalloc(char *s);

00867 #define bstrdupA(B_ARGS, s) bstrdupANoBalloc(s)
00868 #define gstrdup(B_ARGS, s) bstrdupNoBalloc(s)
00869 #define bmemdup(B_ARGS, p, s) bmemdupNoBalloc(p, s)     /* Added by LohCT to support binary file upload. */
00870 
00871 #else /* BALLOC */
00872 
00873 #ifndef B_STATS
00874 #define balloc(B_ARGS, num) balloc(num)
00875 #define bfree(B_ARGS, p) bfree(p)
00876 #define bfreeSafe(B_ARGS, p) bfreeSafe(p)
00877 #define brealloc(B_ARGS, p, size) brealloc(p, size)
00878 #define bstrdup(B_ARGS, p) bstrdup(p)
00879 #define bmemdup(B_ARGS, p, s) bmemdup(p, s)             /* Added by LohCT to support binary file upload. */
00880 
00881 #ifdef UNICODE

00883 #else /* UNICODE */
00884 #define bstrdupA bstrdup
00885 #endif /* UNICODE */
00886 
00887 #endif /* B_STATS */

00889 #define gstrdup bstrdup

00917 #if (defined (UEMF) && defined (WEBS))
00918 /*
00919  *      The open source webserver uses a different callback/timer mechanism
00920  *      than other emf derivative products such as FieldUpgrader agents
00921  *      so redefine those API for webserver so that they can coexist in the
00922  *      same address space as the others.
00923  */
00924 #define emfSchedCallback        websSchedCallBack
00925 #define emfUnschedCallback      websUnschedCallBack
00926 #define emfReschedCallback      websReschedCallBack
00927 #endif /* UEMF && WEBS */
